greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = tau(n'), the number of divisors of the arithmetic derivative of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..65537
mathematica: dn[0] = 0; dn[1] = 0; dn[n_?Negative] := -dn[-n]; dn[n_] := Module[{f = Transpose@ FactorInteger@ n}, If[PrimeQ@n, 1, Total[n*f[[2]]/f[[1]]]]]; (* see A003415 *); f[n_] := DivisorSigma[0, dn@ n]; Array[f, 85, 2] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Mar 12 2018 *)
program: (PARI) rd(n) = {local(fac); if(n<1, 0, fac=factor(n); sum(i=1, matsize(fac)[1], n*fac[i, 2]/fac[i, 1];));}
results.author: _Luca Brigada Villa_, Sep 24 2013
